summaryText: Pastor Travis Hearn delivers an incredibly powerful sermon about facing life's giants, drawing inspiration from the biblical story of David and Goliath! Wow, what an incredible message of hope and courage. Pastor Travis shares his own recent medical journey of suffering a brain aneurysm and stroke, using his personal experience to illustrate how God is bigger than any challenge we face. He breaks down four key strategies for confronting life's 'giants': be strong and courageous, don't listen to negative voices, keep your focus on the right perspective, and let God fight your battles. I love how he emphasizes that courage isn't the absence of fear, but the decision to face it anyway! Pastor Travis reminds us that the giants we're facing might look intimidating, but our God is infinitely more powerful. Whether you're battling a health issue, relationship problem, or personal struggle, this sermon is a powerful reminder that God is with you and He has never lost a battle. The most inspiring moment? When Travis declares that the giants in our past are living proof that God will slay the giants in our future! God didn't bring you this far to drop you now.
mainPoints: Be strong and courageous even when facing overwhelming challenges
Don't listen to negative voices that discourage you from your purpose
Keep your focus on God's power, not the size of your problem

versesMentioned.text: David said to Saul, 'Let no one lose heart on account of this Philistine; your servant will go and fight him.'
'Have I not commanded you? Be strong and courageous. Do not be afraid; do not be discouraged, for the Lord your God will be with you wherever you go.'
You are my hiding place; you will protect me from trouble and surround me with songs of deliverance.
David said to the Philistine, 'You come against me with sword and spear and javelin, but I come against you in the name of the Lord Almighty, the God of the armies of Israel, whom you have defied.'

Monday.scripture: Isaiah 41:10: 'So do not fear, for I am with you; do not be dismayed, for I am your God. I will strengthen you and help you; I will uphold you with my righteous right hand.'
Monday.action: Make a list of your current challenges. Next to each challenge, write one way God might be working in that situation, even if you can't see it yet.
Monday.prayer: Lord, help me see my challenges through Your perspective. Give me courage to face my giants, knowing You are with me. Strengthen my faith and help me trust Your plan. Amen.

Tuesday.scripture: 2 Corinthians 10:4-5: 'The weapons we fight with are not the weapons of the world. On the contrary, they have divine power to demolish strongholds.'
Tuesday.action: Identify one negative thought pattern or voice that has been discouraging you. Consciously replace it with a Scripture that contradicts that negative narrative.
Tuesday.prayer: God, help me take every thought captive. Guard my mind against discouraging voices and help me focus on Your truth. Give me strength to demolish lies with Your powerful word. Amen.

Wednesday.scripture: Philippians 4:13: 'I can do all this through him who gives me strength.'
Wednesday.action: Create a 'victory journal' where you document past challenges you've overcome with God's help. Reflect on how God has been faithful in your past.
Wednesday.prayer: Lord, remind me of Your faithfulness. Help me remember the giants You've already helped me defeat. Renew my confidence in Your power and protection. Amen.

Thursday.scripture: Romans 8:31: 'What, then, shall we say in response to these things? If God is for us, who can be against us?'
Thursday.focus: Recognizing God as your ultimate protector
Thursday.action: Spend time in prayer specifically surrendering your current challenges to God. Visualize laying each 'giant' at His feet.
Thursday.prayer: Heavenly Father, I surrender my battles to You. You are my shield and my strength. Help me trust in Your protection and timing. Give me peace that surpasses understanding. Amen.

Friday.scripture: Psalm 118:6: 'The Lord is with me; I will not be afraid. What can human beings do to me?'
Friday.action: Identify one area where fear has been holding you back. Take a small, brave step towards confronting that fear today.
Friday.prayer: God, replace my fear with courage. Help me step out in faith, knowing You are always with me. Give me boldness to face my challenges. Amen.

Saturday.scripture: 1 John 4:4: 'You, dear children, are from God and have overcome them, because the one who is in you is greater than the one who is in the world.'
Saturday.action: Write a letter to yourself from God's perspective, reminding you of His promises and His power in your life.
Saturday.prayer: Lord, help me live in the victory You've already won. Strengthen my faith to believe in Your promises. Thank You that You are always fighting for me. Amen.
